title: Brazil sees notable drop in homicide rate
subhead: The number of homicides has reached its lowest level since 2012. The result is attributed to public security initiatives introduced by President Lula's government, as well as a truce between the country's main gangs and the aging of Brazil's population.
byline: By Anne-Dominique Correa (Rio de Janeiro, correspondent)

title: 'Dracula': Luc Besson's visual bloodbath filled with clichés and problematic female characters
subhead: The director, aiming for a sweeping romantic epic, instead delivers a film packed with clichés and visual excess.

title: Music festivals in France face fragile economics and unsustainable future
subhead: Businessman Matthieu Pigasse and the group AEG Presents have acquired the We Love Green festival, despite two-thirds of contemporary music events in France ending 2024 in deficit.

title: In Brazil, the free and instant mobile payment system Pix challenges US dominance
subhead: Launched by the Central Bank of Brazil, this system is now used more than credit cards and cash. Its popularity is so great that WhatsApp had to abandon a payment system it wanted to launch locally.

title: In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
subhead: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.
byline: By Guillaume Jan (Manono (Democratic Republic of Congo), special correspondent)
